intro: Daphnopsis bonplandiana var. mollis, commonly known as the velvet daphnopsis, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name, with leaves that are soft to the touch and have a unique, almost waxy texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, and it thrives in cool, moist environments with high humidity. It is often found growing in rocky or shaded forest areas, where it benefits from the cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a plant of conservation concern.
